title.narrative: Supporting and Recovering Several Mid-Scale Participatory Irrigation Schemes and Agricultural Livelihood in Idleb

description.narrative:
The project will support four mid-scale participatory irrigation projects in three vulnerable communities located in Salqin sub-district: Delbiya, Farukiah, and Jikara, all selected communities suffer from severity and hosting one of the highest numbers of IDPs in NW of Syria.
The project will provide full access to irrigation water throughout rehabilitating and upgrading irrigation infrastructures of four irrigation schemes have been established by the local communities for decades and has been ruined over the time and as result of Syrian crisis. Project components have been designed to improve capacity of the targeted communities to sustain households’ livelihood, and to support food availability through longer-term interventions to respond to high vulnerability level of a large part of the population living in the targeted communities
855 HHs working in agriculture as the main income and food resource will be enabled to irrigate 335 hectares of Delbiya strategic plain and the other targeted areas planted with vegetable crops, olive and other trees, moreover, securing water supply regularly will significantly encourage farmers to supply local market with yields of intercropping modality.
The project intervention will be through rehabilitating and scaling up the four irrigation schemes by providing and installing: water pipelines, 7 water pumps, 4 electricity generator sets, electricity network and 11 electrical panels in addition to setting up small scale reservoirs and cleaning 2.5 Km of drainage canal.
Four Water Users Associations management board will be formed by the project beneficiaries themselves and be trained by QRCS experts.
Furthermore, the project will support about 257 HHs from society around the targeted area by providing fertilizing (in-kind) materials and pruning service for rainfed olives trees through cash for work modality as a mitigation measure to lowering any tension between irrigation project beneficiaries and non-beneficiaries.
Selecting beneficiaries of CFW and agriculture input support activities will be based on need and vulnerability with special consideration to IDPs, HHs headed by women and/or disabled people. The project will assist and contribute to the protection of the most vulnerable groups of women, men, girls and boys in all age groups and disabled people in the targeted communities. Beneficiaries have been involved in project designing and implementation through the close coordination with local councils and communities representatives, beneficiaries will be engaged in evaluation through satisfaction survey and complaint mechanism as well.
